question: Make a tea fountain leak proof so it functions properly
option1: Once you have drilled holes for your pump and water line. Insert water line, apply silicone and allow to dry 24 hours to prevent leaks around the lines and drilled holes

question: To bake the best sponge cake.
option1: Always use the freshest eggs possible. The whites of fresh eggs will whip up into a frenzy of air, whereas older eggs struggle to hold it together.
option2: Always use the freshest eggs possible. The whites of fresh eggs will whip up into a frenzy of air, whereas older eggs struggle to cook at all.

make quinoa
option1: Rinse quinoa in a fine mesh sieve until water runs clear, drain and transfer to a medium pot. Add 2 cups water and salt and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat to medium low and simmer until water is absorbed, 15 to 20 minutes. Set aside off the heat for 5 minutes; uncover and fluff with a fork.
option2: Rinse quinoa in a fine mesh sleeve until water runs clear, drain and transfer to a medium pot. Add 2 cups water and salt and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat to medium low and simmer until water is absorbed, 15 to 20 minutes. Set aside off the heat for 5 minutes; uncover and fluff with a fork.

question: To cover edible flowers with egg white evenly.
option1: Beat the egg white in a small bowl just a bit, until slightly foamy. The aim is to break the albumen completely without whisking much air in. This will help you cover the petals evenly. Hold the flower with one hand, dip the paint brush into the egg white and cover the flower like you were painting it. Cover both sides of the petals completely but with a thick layer.
option2: Beat the egg white in a small bowl just a bit, until slightly foamy. The aim is to break the albumen completely without whisking much air in. This will help you cover the petals evenly. Hold the flower with one hand, dip the paint brush into the egg white and cover the flower like you were painting it. Cover both sides of the petals completely but with a thin layer.

question: To check if a piece of chicken is cooked all the way through,

option2: insert a meat thermometer into the middle of the breast and check for 165 degrees.
